name: Rokusei
text:
...Understood.
Don't worry about us here.

Canes runs along the artificial beach of Orient City.
Without a destination, without a place he wants to go-

He can't even think about the future.
His efforts bore no fruit, and he made his sibling sad.
What can he do?

name: Canes
text:
...Someone like me
can't stand beside you, can I?
Please understand, Sterio.

At the edge of the deserted beach area,
Canes stops and
mutters to the returning waves.

name: Goro
text:
Hey Canes,
wait a minute!!

Hearing the clear voice echoing from afar,
Canes turns around.

name: Canes
text: Goro-san...

name: Canes
text:
Sorry. I'm always causing
trouble for everyone.
It wasn't supposed to be like this-

name: Canes
text:
I thought I was doing it for Sterio's sake,
but I didn't think I would
make him so sad...

name: Goro
text:
I see... Canes,
did you reach that conclusion just now
after hearing his feelings?

name: Goro
text:
If you don't know what the other person is thinking,
your considerate actions might backfire, you know?

name: Canes
text: That's-

name: Goro
text:
Let's organize what's happened so far.
Tell me, as someone who knows your father and mother,
I'll listen to you.

name: Sterio
text:
Canes has been listless lately.
So I thought that if I helped my sibling
even more, he would be happy-

name: Sterio
text:
And yet, when I transformed into a hero,
Canes became even more listless.
Instead, I made him sad...

Sterio talks to Rokusei and the others who remained
by his side, telling them about events
from before they visited Hero Festa.

options.text: Why did it turn out the opposite way?
What could be the reason Canes-kun is down?
Are they both hiding their true feelings?

name: Rokusei
text:
That must be related to what Canes-kun
was hesitant to say earlier.

name: Rokusei
text:
For the past few days, he has seemed to be
constantly feeling impatient to me.

name: Rokusei
text:
At first, I thought it was
because he was the only one
who couldn't become a hero, but-

name: Canes
text:
"But if that really came true,
how long do you think it would take?
By then, Sterio, you-"

name: Rokusei
text:
-You must surely
have noticed it, Sterio-kun.
Would you mind telling me?

After a little hesitation, he cautiously speaks.
While worriedly observing everyone's expressions,
concerned he might hurt the listener-

name: Canes
text:
Sterio, he's so cheerful now,
but apparently, he won't live
that long.

name: Canes
text:
He grows much faster than
my and my parents' species, so he'll
reach his lifespan first, or so they say...

name: Goro
text:
...!
Does he himself
know about that?

Canes nods to Goro's surprised question
and continues speaking.

name: Canes
text:
I was "supposed to still not know" about it.
But I happened to overhear
my parents talking about it-

name: Canes
text:
So I pretended not to know anything
and spent time with him.
But still... I thought about a lot of things.

name: Canes
text:
Sterio always talks to me cheerfully.
So I can't look gloomy.

name: Sterio
text:
Canes is always kind to me.
Sometimes he complains, but
he always fulfills my requests.

name: Sterio
text:
Papa and Mama, everyone is like that.
So I want to return the favor to my family.
I want to use my remaining time for everyone.

name: Sterio
text:
Whether it's errands or hunting,
I want more and more
roles for myself...

name: Rokusei
text:
You want to be useful to everyone, huh...?
Hey Sterio-kun, is that truly your wish?

name: Rokusei
text:
No matter how kind your family
surrounds you, can you still live for others when
you know the time you'd have to say goodbye?

Sterio nods while looking down
at the question posed to him.
Rokusei continues to speak to him.

name: Rokusei
text:
Canes-kun probably
can't understand why
you can be okay.

name: Sterio
text:
-I wasn't okay at all.
When I heard about my lifespan,
I cried a lot, a lot.

name: Sterio
text:
I cried a lot then, so now I'm okay.
I'm not sad, and I'm not scared.
You don't need to worry about me.

Saying that, Sterio smiles at everyone.
Just as he showed himself to Canes
before he left the place.

options.text: He's putting on a brave face...

name: Canes
text:
From that day on, I've been thinking.
What can I do for my sibling
within our limited time together-

name: Canes
text:
First, I thought I had no choice but to become
the strongest hunter, worthy of being Sterio's partner,
and I've continued to train ever since.

name: Canes
text:
Even then, and now, all I could do
was create many good memories
with him.

name: Canes
text:
And yet, no matter how much I train every day,
my abilities don't improve,
and Sterio just keeps leaving me behind...

name: Canes
text:
Seeing him always carefree and unchanged
makes me feel relieved, but at the same time,
I can't help but think this-

name: Canes
text:
No matter how hard I try,
it probably doesn't matter
to Sterio.

name: Canes
text:
Rather, he'd be free if he left me,
and he'd be happier that way.

The impatience of unfulfilled efforts,
jealousy towards someone superior to him, and
feelings for his family become intertwined.

The more he struggles,
the more these emotions become entangled,
so complex that Canes himself
can no longer untangle them.

name: Canes
text:
I don't want to make him sad,
I didn't want to fight...
Now, I don't know what to do!

-Then ask for help from others.
That's much better than
brooding alone.

A voice came from a little distance away.
Rough words, but never pushing the other away,
awkward words of encouragement.

name: Goro
text:
Genji...
What are you doing here,
did you follow us?

name: Genji
text:
Your silly outfit,
its battle performance is useless
and it can't protect civilians.

He scolds the parties involved for their carelessness,
and then, somewhat awkwardly,
addresses the troubled boy again.

name: Genji
text:
...Sorry. I had no intention of eavesdropping or
meddling in other people's affairs,
even though I wasn't asked.

name: Genji
text:
But since I've heard it, I'll say it.
Listen, kid, don't be "alone".

name: Genji
text:
Humans are troublesome beings.
Most of them push others away when they're struggling
and try to carry everything by themselves.

name: Genji
text:
And then, before they know it,
they do something irreversible-
That's what happened to me.

name: Genji
text:
If you don't want to suffer the same fate,
remember and say it.
What did you wish for first?

name: Genji
text:
Before you overthink things in your head,
what did you feel and wish for?
Calm down and recall.

name: Genji
text:
Otherwise, you'll stray from your path
and pass each other by...
You don't want an end like that, do you?

Genji's straightforward words
pierce Canes' heart,
serving as an impetus for self-reflection.

name: Canes
text:
I want to leave memories with Sterio-
No, I myself.
As a sibling, as a good hunter.

name: Canes
text:
But my abilities don't keep up at all,
and time just passes...
It's frustrating, but there's nothing I can do.

name: Canes
text:
It's scary to part with him like this,
and I want to be with him forever, but for me,
the one seeing him off, to say such selfish things-

name: Genji
text:
That's fine. You're dealing with something
as unreasonable as lifespan.
Feel free to be as selfish as you want.

name: Genji
text:
The one speaking, and the one listening...
That's something you can only do
while you're both alive, you know.

name: Rokusei
text:
-Sterio-kun.
Do you really think nothing is sad,
like that?

Rokusei poses further questions to the boy,
who unconsciously turns away from himself
by worrying about his sibling.

However, the person who spoke the words
himself wears a face that seems to disbelieve
what just happened.

name: Rokusei
text:
Oh-why did I
get involved in something unnecessary?
I shouldn't have done something like this before.

name: Rokusei
text:
Infiltrating Hero Festa was just a way to buy time until
the internal affairs of that organization settled down.

name: Rokusei
text:
Did I not learn from the Kyoto incident?
That meddling too deeply in other people's affairs
increases the things you don't want to lose (weaknesses).

name: Rokusei
text:
They are just civilians, and one of them just awakened.
Unlike typical heroes,
they can easily lose their lives.

name: Rokusei
text:
I, who live in a world of intrigue and deception,
shouldn't get deeply involved
with these children. And yet-

In his self-reflection, Rokusei realizes
that he wants to get involved with them,
even if it means putting his own position aside.

name: Rokusei
text:
The fear of possibly losing something precious,
and the sadness of having lost it,
are feelings that everyone naturally holds.

name: Rokusei
text:
That's why you couldn't suppress your tears
when Canes-kun told you to be free earlier,
couldn't you?

name: Rokusei
text:
Having a place where you finally belong-
Because you would lose something
you cherish more than anything, in a way you didn't want.

name: Rokusei
text:
He too must feel the same,
he must be terribly afraid
of losing you, a precious family member, someday.

name: Rokusei
text:
-Ah, that's right.
It's because I reunited with [Player]
in a place like this.

name: Rokusei
text:
Because I recalled the days spent with that
good-natured "Observer" who probably never
even considered the usefulness of others-

name: Rokusei
text:
I even recalled my old self
from when I was with that person,
overlapping myself with you boys.

dialogue_after_selection.text: Noticing that he is being watched, but unable to discern the intention, [Player] calls out to Rokusei.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Rokusei
dialogue_after_selection.text: ...It's okay, it's nothing to worry about.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Rokusei
dialogue_after_selection.text: Seriously... me, talking about something so out of character, [Player], it's your fault, you get me?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Rokusei
dialogue_after_selection.text: Just kidding, I shouldn't be taking it out on you...

name: Rokusei
text:
Sterio-kun, it's okay to cry.
You don't have to force yourself to erase sadness or fear,
you can move forward while holding them.

name: Rokusei
text:
Especially if you have someone to walk with.
...Now, tell me again.
What do you truly desire?

Hearing Rokusei's words,
Sterio again sheds large tears profusely.

name: Sterio
text:
When I first met the monsters here,
I realized I couldn't defeat them normally,
and I became very anxious.

name: Sterio
text:
If my family disappears, I'll be alone.
If I can't protect my family, I'll fail as a hunting dog.
In either case, I will no longer have a place to call home.

name: Sterio
text:
...I don't want to lose it.
The connection I was given, my unique role-
I want to be "everyone's hunting dog" forever.

name: Sterio
text:
Otherwise, I'll have nothing.
I don't need freedom, and there's no substitute for family.
So... I want to be with everyone until the very end.

Sterio wishes to be useful to his family
precisely because he wants to protect
his one and only place.

Because protecting the people who gave him
happiness he shouldn't have received
leads to his own peace.

name: Pubraseer
text:
-Sterio-kun.
If that is your wish,
there's something I should tell you.

Pubraseer, who had been watching the conversation unfold,
speaks and gently advises him.

name: Pubraseer
text:
The peace of this world is fragile.
As long as monsters exist, you might suddenly
lose something precious one day.

name: Pubraseer
text:
It was the same when for me once-
A long time ago
on a spaceship with my companions.

name: Pubraseer
text:
This world is always sudden and unreasonable,
and you never know when you'll
have to say farewells.

name: Pubraseer
text:
You two siblings seem to be only worried
about you leaving first, Sterio-kun, but-

name: Pubraseer
text:
Canes-kun could get into an accident or fall ill,
and there's a chance that he might pass away before you.

Sterio had unconsciously avoided thinking about
the terrifying possibilities of the future
told through Pubraseer's own experience.

Facing him, pale,
Pubraseer encourages him,
assuring him it will be okay.

name: Pubraseer
text:
It's not too late yet, Sterio-kun.
Become strong with Canes-kun.
So that you can both be individuals.

Concerned for their future, Pubraseer
makes them aware of the challenge of independence
that they will eventually have to face.

name: Pubraseer
text:
I too once lived together with my
companions as independent crew members,
in one community (ship).

name: Pubraseer
text:
You two are the same.
Neither is master nor subordinate; an individual hunter
and hunting dog will run one community (home) together.

name: Sterio
text:
......
...Alone, but together...?

Sterio was encouraged by the former captain's
authoritative words, but
he couldn't quite understand their meaning.

name: Pubraseer
text:
-Ah, I think that's the kind of relationship
you should aim for.

name: Pubraseer
text:
...Thank you, [Player].
I couldn't find the words
to express it to him clearly.

Anxiety and sadness still remain, but
the courage everyone gave him
dwells in Sterio's eyes, who had been afraid of change.

name: Pubraseer
text:
Sterio-kun. If you are
interested in my suggestion...
What do you think you should do first?

name: Sterio
text:
...!!
I'm going to talk to Canes!
Everyone, are you coming too?

Hearing Genji's words,
Canes, unable to hold back, wipes
away his overflowing tears with his arm.

name: Canes
text:
From the day I learned his secret,
I decided I would never cry again.
Because, Sterio must be suffering much more.

name: Canes
text:
But that was just my selfish assumption...
Everything I had been thinking about until now, too.

name: Goro
text:
Your father said it.
Canes always rushes ahead in his head
and ends up falling.

Gently stroking Canes' head,
Goro speaks in a calm voice.

name: Goro
text:
Genji and I, we've both
lost our children for various reasons,
so we care about you two even more.

name: Goro
text:
In a world where everyday life can be destroyed
at any moment, I want you to live
as you wish, without regrets.

name: Goro
text:
Strengths and weaknesses, likes and dislikes.
Your personalities may be completely different,
but you can still cry and laugh together.

name: Goro
text:
Then, don't pity your sibling by yourself...
You know what to do next, right?

Canes's reddened eyes, having wiped away his tears,
hold a firm resolve and gaze directly
at the spot where his sibling was.

name: Canes
text:
Thank you, everyone.
I'm going to talk to Sterio-

A roar. And a giant waterspout rises.
The moment Canes' expression returned to normal.

name: Octopus Monster
text: -Gyaoooohhh!!

Chapter 5:
The Wind of Impermanence Does Not Choose Its Time
